Dennis and Ben were great hosts and left us many extra sweet touches for us to enjoy! We enjoyed the stay in the camper and were very comfortable. But we really loved the gem of the outdoor space! The outdoor shower was so fun too! The space was quiet and relaxing. Great weekend getaway!

Fantastic stay! Surprised my boyfriend for his birthday with this spot, and we both loved it. Listing was 100% accurate. Great location close to downtown Mount Airy, although we spent most of our time enjoying the river and the solitude. Definitely will be back!

Wonderful place with even more wonderful hosts.  This is an outdoor lovers happy place.  The Tiny Rock House is located on the river with a great back yard with a swing/couch that is great for naps!  Lot's of comfortable and unique chairs/tables to enjoy the view.  Dennis and Ben greeted us and showed us around when we arived.  And left us delights in the trailer to enjoy on our stay that also included s'more supplies to toast in the firepit.  Enjoyed every minute of our stay!

Dennis and Ben’s place is absolutely fantastic! Pictures will never do it justice. The care and creativity they have poured into this magical, private spot is very obvious and make it a fun, comfortable, relaxing spot. The camper is (obviously) small but they have done a phenomenal job with the efficiency and usage of the space and we had everything we could have wanted/ needed. Very Impressive!
We could not have had a better time and really hope to come back here!
Also, they were very attentive, communicative, and kind! Y’all are The best!

Dennis & Ben’s place was even better than we had imagined and had everything we needed for a romantic weekend away. If you’re contemplating whether this is the right place… do it! Take the time to disconnect from your phone and work and enjoy the relaxing river and “mini” beach. Thanks for a wonderful stay, Dennis & Ben!

Super little trailer with great grounds and relaxing atmosphere!!! Communication with host was off the charts A++++. A couple things to note, my husband is 6'1" tall and until he got used to height kept hitting his head on low ceiling and the bed was very short for him. Outside shower was good for his height but could not use the indoor one.  Although the outdoor shower was great fun and we loved it.😉  During winter months would not have worked out so well. Also did have limited hot water available.  But we did have a great time and would recommend

I cannot say enough wonderful things about the tiny rock cabin.  Not only is it soooooo comfortable (we slept so well) but it is beyond peaceful and serene. Super super clean. Dennis and Ben were beyond amazing hosts! We now consider them friends!!! The place has everything you need plus some. It is the absolute perfect getaway. The Ararat river offers lots of fun too! We cannot wait to return!  This place is a must must must! We’ve traveled the world and this by far, is one of our favorite places!

This space is quirky and beautiful. My son and I visited and enjoyed the water and beach. If you want tv, know it’s not easy to stream anything. We had some luck with a hot spot and device. It’s bring your own wi-fi. The space is cute and close to two breweries. There is a regional museum across from the winery that’s lovely. It is four floors and has a surprising amount of well-down exhibits. We had a great time with responsive hosts.

This exceeded expectations and the hospitality of Dennis & Ben even further turned my week long trip here to a dream come true! Super close to any need in town yet truly remote and private with expansive views for all sorts of outdoor scenery.

15 min drive to Pilot Mountain for long nature hikes and 3 minutes from several beautiful river-side walking trails!

The bed was amazingly comfortable - HOT water with great pressure...really every amenity you could ask for while still that 'camping' feeling. The outdoor swinging couch is one piece I miss the most, perfect for lounging and reading or even sleep out there under the stars! I LOVED IT and will be back again and again!! So lucky to have found it and to meet Dennis & Ben - all gems and multiple five stars! Thank you :)

It's a neat little hideaway with all kinds of curiosities. I brought two pre-teens and they enjoyed it a lot; they liked the river and beach, having some space to roam in, the playground on the other side of the river was nice, and the huge fire pit was great for a chilly night. The home is a converted camper (pretty much everything on site is reused), cozy and warm. I think the novelty might wear off on a long stay but two days while visiting family was quite comfortable. The price seems just a little steep to stay in a camper, not exactly luxurious (especially indoor shower is quite cramped), but the hosts are very thoughtful and generous, and it's a good location with a lot of character. Give it a try for something a little different.

It's clean, open, well lit and prepped for the perfect outdoor grill and campfire experience.....and it's on the river in a  nice secluded spot. I'll be back, convenience to everything and hosts were great. Going back when I'm in Mt. Airy for sure
House is small outdoor area is amazing !! Would recommend to everyone

This was my first experience at an Airbnb. The location is secluded with plenty of outdoor space. The river is within a stone's throw for fishing. We stayed for three days and had a great time. I would encourage anyone to check it out.

Ben and Dennis’ Space is very unique! Perfect for outdoor loving couples. They were very communicative with a quick response time. They added little special touches to make the stay easy on us. Outdoor area was awesome! They offered everything you would need to enjoy the River which is only a very short distance from the porch.
Dennis & Ben’s place was so special. We enjoyed the river and hanging out on the couch swing. Their property is so beautifully unique! Highly recommend it.
We enjoyed our stay at the little rock house! It's rather small but if you enjoy glamping or camping in general, this place is great! Also super close to downtown Mayberry. Such a cute town!

This is such a unique space and setting. We were visiting family in the area so didn’t spend too much time “at home,” but there were lots of great places to hang out and enjoy the outdoors. The location is right by downtown attractions but feels secluded and private. If you’re in search of something out of the ordinary, check this place out!

Beautiful and convenient to downtown Mt. Airy and the winding Granite Greenway, this Glamping retreat  offers fun and refreshing riverfront views and access to the Ararat with privacy and the "illusion of seclusion" .  The sandy beach, the rocked terrace and decking with it's picnic tables and really comfortable bed swing encouraged us to enjoy outdoors right there.  The night time uplighting in the trees is nothing less than spectacular.  We saw deer, turkey, and coyote right from our deck!

photos.caption: The outdoor shower with hot and cold running water!

name: Escape to a Romantic and Magical  Hobbit  Retreat

reviews.comments: Its a summer place to stay as the facilities are good for good weather not in the middle of winter. The local garden centre does really good food by the way. In the summer you can cook outside BBQ or camping stove. Limited numbers of plates and cutlery with no washing facility. Lovely place in the middle of lovely countryside.
reviews.response:
DearAndy, we are very disappointed to read your review and ratings on behalf of your daughter as we have only ever had excellent feedback and ratings from our glamping guests :-(
Unfortunately if you book a UK glamping break in Winter then wet and cold weather is to be expected.
There is a detailed and accurate description of our listing which clearly states what cooking and washing facilities are available and because your review is pubic then I need to defend the fact that there are plenty of plates and cutlery!
In fact, as it was your daughters mini-moon, we went the extra mile and put congratulation banners and a bottle of Prosecco as well as other thoughtful treats inside the Hobbit home

reviews.comments:
My partner and I stayed here over New Years Eve and wow, I'm so glad we did. It was the perfect, cosy hideaway! The Hobbit Hole is just as described and the bed was possibly the softest, comfiest bed I've ever slept in. The birdsong and nature on a morning was the perfect accompaniment to a cup of fresh coffee. Just the most blissful place. I left feeling recharged and relaxed!

On top of this, Samantha and Simon were fantastic hosts - super helpful and attentive. There's nothing they wouldn't do. Thank you!
reviews.response: Thanks for such a lovely review, all the best for 2023! xx

reviews.comments: We loved every minute of our stay! Sam is a wonderful host, excellent communication, kind and friendly as well. the hobbit home was like  childhood dream come true for me, and we will definitely be back in 2023! to quote Tolkien himself; 'it was a hobbit hole; and that means comfort'
reviews.response: Thank you for your lovely review xx

reviews.comments: Loved this stay, very cute and cosy, stayed in minus temperatures and couldn’t believe how warm it was!! The shower room is cold in winter but to be expected, quick jump in the shower so not a problem as we weren’t hanging around in there and this is glamping! Surroundings gorgeous, fab local pub and we loved Nantwich! Sam was a fab host, lovely little touches left for us and nothing seemed to be too much for her! Thank you!!
I can't recommend the Hobbit Hole enough! It has been wonderfully thought out so that everything you need is there. Great host and a beautiful area. Would deffinately stay again.

Wonderful! Perfect in every way. Sam and Simon were kind and caring hosts. The Hobbit Hole was warm , welcoming, and relaxing. The area is beautiful, with scenic, peaceful walks and friendly pubs with good beer and food. We will definitely visit again, and will be recommending it to family and friends.
Can't give enough stars, such lovely hosts and every detail thought of, beautiful place to stay and would recommend to everyone. Perfect escape for anyone needing a little break!

Don’t really know how to word how amazing this weekend was, booked it as my boyfriends birthday surprise and it was the best decision I’ve ever made. From start to finish everything was perfect, Sam and Simon had covered everything and made us feel so comfortable! There isn’t anything I can think of that they could have added/done differently! Im recommending this place to everyone. 2 days was not enough ❤️

What can I say, the hobbit house truly is the most magical experience! Sam and Simon are such wonderful hosts, they have thought of literally everything! The area is so peaceful and relaxing, with the hobbit house so cosy and comfortable. There are plenty of lovely pubs nearby, and the house even has LOTR extended editions on DVD for those rainy days! There’s everything there that you could possibly need. It feels like a home away from home. We enjoyed our stay so much and will  certainly be back again soon! Thank you so much Sam and Simon, it was a pleasure to meet you and stay in your fantastic hobbit house!  🧙‍♂️
The hobbit hole is absolutely perfect in every way, Lord of the rings fan or not. They really have thought of everything to make your stay there relaxing and stress free.

One of the most magical places we’ve ever stayed! Took our breath away when we first saw it and immediately felt at home. Sam and Simon were so welcoming and really helpful. Everything you could need was provided. We loved cooking on the outdoor grill and sat around the fire pit both nights listening to music and relaxing. Little touches inside and outside the hobbit hole showed just how much Sam & Simon value the comfort of their guests. The setting and wildlife are amazing. Look out for the giant tortoise and miniature shetland pony! Would recommend a visit to Audlem for breakfast, and the Bridgemere garden centre has the best butchers! We also visited the Boar’s Head for dinner, delicious! And alao Hack Green secret nuclear bunker which was fascinating. We cannot wait to stay again and make the most of this serene and beautiful location. 5 stars!!!! xx

Such a gorgeous little house, we had the most relaxing stay. The hosts are lovely and friendly and it was great to have the whole field to ourselves which made the stay extra special. I don't always sleep well when I'm away but the beds are so snug and cosy that it wasn't an issue... at all. Spotlessly clean and tidy too. Never visited Cheshire before and would return just for the Snugburys Ice Cream experience (thanks for the info Hobbit Hosts!). 100% recommend this treat of an Airbnb.

Absolutely fantastic stay! Loved the whole experience. Just what we needed, time out away from life. No wifi, no real phone signal, just pure down time. Its been absolutely lovely. Couldnt have wanted anything more, private, homely and best of all we felt like royalty.  Birthday banner up for my partners birthday plus a lovely card. So much to do there, we did the local pub which was so friendly, Cheshire zoo which is an hour away on pretty stright wide roads, and ordered a really nice takeaway. We will 100% be back! Both me and my partner didn't want to leave! Next time i will be taking binoculars to watch the birds and wild life! Tiny tim (shetland pony) was awesome! And hes on your right leaving and entering, not to mention the gard puppies with there fluffy heads 😍  thank you sam your the best x

We had a fantastic time at the hobbit hole! It was a lovely experience to stay in such a unique place, it was even better than we imagined! It feels very private but the communication was excellent if we needed anything. I would happily stay here again!
We had a lovely time here with our 3 year old daughter. A quirky glamping experience with super friendly hosts who have provided everything you might need and lots of great local recommendations.
Great stay in a great place. Sam was great and the butchers she recommends superb. Would come back again.
Loved the Hobbit Hole ! Beautiful part of Cheshire , lovely hosts, fun accommodation , enjoyed playing on the little field on an evening. Cooking on grill was ace . So much to do local . Thank you
A lovely place to stay with everything you need. Samantha and Simon are so friendly and welcoming. We look forward to returning.

An absolutely perfect stay in a wonderful hobbit home! From the start, Samantha was clear and quick with all communication helping prep everything before our arrival. As it was a surprise birthday trip, we were thoughtfully greeted to a happy birthday banner which put a smile on the birthday boys face for sure! The house itself is like something out of the films, with extra attention to detail ensuring you have everything you need. The bed was so comfortable, best sleep we've had in ages! Thank you so much again to Samantha and Simon, we can't wait to come back! Xx
We loved our stay at the amazing hobbit hole. Sam & Simon were brilliant host too. Would most definitely recommend to anyone wanting a little getaway in a beautiful location . X

photos.caption: Beautiful Hobbit style cosy wooden snug
Peace and tranquillity in your own private space.
This is a recliner sofa, and sooooo comfortable!
Outdoor cooking area - it has a teppanyaki grill, and an electric hob, there is also the coal bbq to cook on as well as the fire pit
Our dogs like to get in on every photo! :))
So cosy in the snow and frosty weather
So pretty, even in the rain
A single campbed can fit in the bedroom for a child or can be moved to the lounge for an adult :)
The view behind the Hobbit home
Our rustic shower shed and gazebo
Our outdoor cooking area which is available all year round so that you can use the teppanyaki hot plate/ mini oven or 2 ring stove
Outdoor cooking area, with a teppanyaki hot plate for your meat, eggs, anything you want really, plus a 2 ring hob
Our semi wild rabbit relaxing in the sunshine ☀️

primaryHost.about: I'm a retired college manager and international examiner and have been  lucky in that I have been able to travel to some amazing places with my job - I love meeting people, travelling to new places and enjoying new cultures, absolutely love all animals, nature and enjoy good food! I'm married to Simon and have a daughter who is currently at University :-)

reviews.comments: What a great Airbnb! Super cozy and charming in a beautiful location in Norway. Getting there was a bit of a chore especially during the Winter with the snow and ice, but either way amazing little place and felt right at home. 10/10.
Loved it !
Fabulous
super cozy - squeaky clean - extremely comfy bed - just perfect!
Nathalie was extremely forthcoming and everything was very nice and cosy. It‘s a beautiful place to stay.

The hobbit home is whimsical and makes an amazing stay - almost like a movie set! Particularly impressed that it has all the facilities you might need for cooking, eating, etc in such a cosy space. Place was impeccably clean and Nathalie was really nice.
Fantastic stay, and very easy to check in and out. The surrounding area had a surprising amount of things to experience. Highly recommended.
The place was absolutely perfect, clean, well equipped, comfortable. Lovely surroundings, extra nice hosts!
Super duper! Good host! Enjoyed our stay. Perfect for some walking and wandering in the Woods and mountains.

If you want an authentic farm stay in a unique AirBnb, look no further! Nathalie's accommodation is truly one of a kind, furnished enough for a couple and truly worth the experience! Nathalie was also very thoughtful and provided a welcome gift for our recent marriage, and even helped to facilitate the ferry crossing at Fjoneferka even though we were late.

Very comfortable and beautiful house, with everything you need! We really enjoyed our stay.
Nathalie was very uncomplicated and everything went super easy and quickly!
Would recommend it for everyone!! :)
Amazing, simply amazing. Natalie is a lovely host.
great stay, great host and very cozy!

The hobbit house was a special appartement on our Norway trip! It is located on the property of Nathalie besides horse and sheep pens with its own fire place. The house is very comfortable and there are great hiking and climbing areas easily reachable from there!

I will definitely come back here!

Beautiful little house with nice hikes in close proximity. The house is well equipped and super cozy.
There is a big dog coming for a visit now and then, so if you travel with your dog make sure he or she is sociable.

Beautiful little hobbit house, very well equipped and comfortable.
Perfect experience for one night.
100% recommended

Great place to stay when exploring Telemark and visiting jettegrytene and sandy beaches nearby.
We enjoyed being able to sit around the fire in the evening. Our kids loved the hobbit house.
Good place for a couple or a family with one or two children.
Thanks for the hospitality and a cosy fun place to stay the night!

Wonderful accommodation! we stayed 2 Nights, had a nice BBQ on the fire, a small little hike nearby and even a quick swim in the lake!
Nathalie was really helpfull also in organizing almost a private ferry ride 😊
Nice little house in the garden of the owners

It was unexpected experience to be having it was above our imagination to have such a wonderful time in this place , the hobbit house was so amazing and comfy and so much attention was paid to the smallest details , Nathalie and her husband Albert was so kind and sweet and would help out in anyway they can , you will only need a few days grocery shopping for the time your staying , i would say its a 5 star hotel but in wonderful place

photos.caption: Baderom med toalett og dusj i tillegg
Her er det bare å kose seg!
Utsikt fra sengen, noen ganger kommer naboen sine hester på besøk
Fra verandaen til parkeringsplassen deres og huset vårt
Klar for neste gjest, er det deg?
Noe å feire? Vi kan oftest hjelpe til med å ordne noe spesielt.
Vi hjelper gjerne med romantiske overraskelser!
Mye å gjøre i Nissedal og omgivelse!
Hobbithuset er godt isolert og er også komfortabel i vinter. Huset vårt i bakgrunnen

primaryHost.about: Vi har bod i Norge i snart 10 år og har lenge drømt om å ha ei hytte ved huset vårt. Nå har drømmen blitt realisert og gleder vi oss til å møte mange forskjellige gjester. Vi elsker å bo på Fjone og vil gjerne dele vår flotte omgivelse med gjestene våre. Vi er ikke alltid hjemme, men med gode avtaler kan vi være fleksible.

name: The Roundabout Cabin near Portsmouth, Ohio

reviews.comments: We always enjoy our stay at the Roundabout Cabin! It's a great base for our holiday visits to family.

Thank you Kristen for your spirit of hospitality, it was deeply felt in your communication and in your home - cabin. It was a true gift to be able to take rest and truly enjoy the beauty and magnificence of the inside and out. It gave us great renewal and true inspirations as we dream into a build at home. Next time we will book - stay for longer!!  Wishes of well-being, joy and peace.

If you love architecture and design, you will not want to miss visiting this cabin located in a beautiful woodland setting with creek flowing on the property!  Enjoy the outside scenes from any location in this finely appointed home.  We can’t wait to find a date in the spring or summer when we can return!
We loved the place, the fireplace was amazing.
Great stay

If you’re considering booking this cabin, take my advice and do it! My husband and I stayed there to celebrate our anniversary and my birthday. We enjoy our stay. It’s was exactly what we needed. The cabin is beautiful and so relaxing! Kristen was great with communication /accommodations. We will definitely book again! :)

Well, the location was perfect as it was the last time I stayed here.  However, it was not so pleasant due to continual rain. The first sign of sun was as I was loading my car to leave. I made the best of it with some baking and snuggling under a fleece. I thoroughly enjoyed one night by firing up the wood burner and watching TV. Next time I’ll check the weather forecast. I was just anxious to return. I have back problems and I’m guessing the weather caused that to flare up. Any problems I had while there were ones I brought with me! Kristen and Heather were still the best!

Cannot say enough good things about this place. The pictures do not do it justice. The architecture is amazing. What a magnificent house. We want to come back in Spring when everything is green!
The place was very clean. It is very homey. It has everything you need to fully enjoy your time there. Having a fire in the fireplace in the living room was our favorite part of evenings. In spite of being a cabin in a very wooded area, it was nice and clean. Literally the only thing that did not look clean was the windows and it was from rain and elements.
This place cannot disappoint. It is such a special house. Not sure it can be compared to any other!
Our dog had a great time checking out the outdoors! We even had deer come up early AM one day
Place was great, exactly as listed. Pay close attention to the listing, there are plenty of steps for a small place, and there’s no railing, as the host says.
Everything I imagined for a lovely weekend getaway! Definitely would love to come back
enjoyed a relaxing couple of days with one of my daughters. we love the shower. nice and clean. watched some birds from the dining room windows. wish we lived closer. would go back if in the area.
Gorgeous space unlike anything else !! Communication was great the amenities were perfect and the location was very private
My husband and I loved the uniqueness of this cabin.  We have never stayed anywhere with as much character as the Roundabout Cabin.  Thank you for sharing this wonderful place!
Perfect spot for a couple day stay for our anniversary ! Definitely Recommend for a Relaxing couple day !
This house is so interesting. It was also super clean and a great location. I’d definitely recommend.

We had the most amazing time at this beautiful cabin! It truly is like something out of a fairytale and such a peaceful setting. We loved the fire pit and spent our evenings enjoying the fire under the stars. The shower was awesome too! We definitely want to come back!

This place is really cool. Cooler than it looks and probably cooler than you think. Well equipped, great bed and shower, and in a great spot that is both secluded but not isolated, giving a great balance of privacy and relaxation without the fear of being alone in the woods! Highly recommend!

OMG amazing stay, such a beautiful home and area and major bonus you can bring your furry kids!!! My Wife and I came here Oct 26th-29th 2022 for our honeymoon!! We loved it so much and brought our beautiful pitbull with us who just loved the outdoors that surrounds this gorgeous cabin!! The shower is a MUST!!! It’s was amazing to gather wood for the Beautiful stone fireplace inside! There is also a fire place outside! 10/10 would recommend everyday! We will be back!!
Fabulous for a romantic getaway, Plan on sharing a bed with whoever you're traveling with!

WOW what a fun place! Quirky, cozy, lovely, and large. It was all i hoped for from the pictures and more. You are deep in the woods with amazing views and lots you can do outside. There are other homes in the area so you are not isolated but you feel like you have the woods to your self. A fire pit, a platform overlooking the creek, great views for the multitude of windows and almost a fantasy feel to the place. I woke up in the middle of the night and dont know the last time i was somewhere that was that quiet. I loved it and the only complaint i have is that i did not plan on staying longer. I will be back.

One of the best Airbnb’s I stayed in.
The place looks marvelous, sparkling clean, cozy and very private.
The views are spectacular and the position is really magical. The unique design of the house makes it even more special.
We loved our days at the mirror house. Also, the host was incredibly sweet.
If you are looking for a relaxing vacation in a very private area this is the place to go to.
Wonderful place and home, quiet and Sabina was a great host, gave us indications about the city and check-in was quiet simple. I really liked our stay
Beautiful! We went there with our 6 months old boy and it was fabulous. We would come back again.
Great host and beautiful property
We had a wonderful stay and everything was as expected. Bozen is close and wonderful for a visit.
Lovely location, quiet and peaceful. The pool is shared but quite big. Great experience!

We had a great 5 night-stay at both mirror houses (one for us and our 10 months old and one for the grandparents). The sleek design and the spacious open living room was perfect for our little guy to crawl around with not too many obstacles or hazards - and the same in the garden and pool area: he just loved the soft, well kept grass. The baby crib/travel bed was even set up with an extra mattress and cute baby towels were provided.
We particularly enjoyed the private pool, the amazing view, the breeze in the morning by opening up the big sliding door and the skylights, and the feel of remoteness in the middle of the apple orchards while being able to walk to the grocery store and Salewa bivac for a snack or order pizza (pizza house st. Jakob - 30 min!). What a great location for a basecamp to explore Bolzano and the dolomites.

We had such a lovely stay in Sabina’s beautiful Mirror House. My son and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The architecture is magnificent, and all the details were top notch - you can tell with the workmanship, the furniture, the guide book, and we noticed, even the key chain!

We appreciated the hospitality and accommodation that the owners and caretakers extended to us to make it special. Sabina and Judith were so lovely and helpful, and made our stay even better.

We enjoyed the pool area during sunny days. It is truly, truly memorable, and have already recommended it to our friends.

The Mirror House has such a cool architectural design and had everything that we needed. It was such a great experience to wake up looking out the front windows to see the sun come up over the  orchards.
The mirror house exceeded our expectations! From design to detail it really was a fantastic place to stay! One we will remember for a long time to come.
Beautiful house in Bolzano surrounded by mountains and apple trees. We loved our stay and would definitely come back

Great unique place to stay in quiet area with incredible design. Comfortable and great host that explained everything and helpful with great communication. Recommend everyone coming to Bolzano choose this place.
The mirror houses are a great and unique place to stay.  You can’t go wrong staying here if you’re looking to explore the Dolomites, taste the amazing local cuisine or go shopping in Bolzano.

Beautiful mirror house. Hard to find definitely use google maps! Places not open to late in area. Great communication and help finding it from host. Small but very peaceful and nice waking up to Mountain View’s. Would stay again!
Amazing host with wonderful house. Loved our stay to the moon and back!

The Mirror House South is spectacular in its design, technology and aesthetic. It sits amid fields of apple orchards and is an an oasis within Bolzano. Our host was kind, generous in offering local suggestions. The pool and the pool house were an added treat to our stay. Thank you.

Sabina and her husband were very accommodating and considerate hosts.  They were very helpful during my stay despite my having difficulties driving to Bolzano at night after my flight was delayed. The Mirror Houses are a gem,  I sincerely hope to visit again in the future.

The houses are quite nice though they seem more spacious on the pictures. The host who met us was not super friendly. Firsts she asked to park my car straight skidding but I have a huge GL Mercedes and it did not fit to the parking lot and it was guide obvious to everyone. So I parked it in parallel. Than I asked for the cleaning lady to come once during our stay but she did not even change the sheets. And the cleaning cost 30 euro but I left 50 in the house hoping that she could return some change but she has taken all 50 euro. And check in procedure was quite long.

Sabine was an amazingly professional host. Staying at the Mirror Houses felt like staying at a luxury hotel, but with all the care and charm of a B&B.

The house itself is amazing. And the location feels beautifully nestled amidst the mountains and the apple orchards.

Sabine was super helpful with activity and restaurant recommendations and was even able to get us a reservation on a particularly busy weekend.

Would love to come back!

„Wow!“ That’s what we thought when we looked at the pictures in the web. And it was „Wow!“ again when we arrived at Mirror Houses.They ARE like they look on the photos. Great design, tasteful interior. At the same time cosy and comfortable. Hosts Sabina and Victoria gave us a warm welcome. They show up quickly if yo need something, without beeing obtrusive. Their newly published ‚City Guide’ contains interesting shopping and excursion tips in and around Bolzano. Getting there: The last three or four kilometres are a little adventurous, leading through industral areas – but when arriving in the middle of apple plantations you finally reach a place of calm and relaxation, surrounded by hundreds of apple trees.
Bernd & Christine

primaryHost.about: Hometown Bolzano, Italy.

reviews.comments:
Unforgettable experience with Mohammed and his family.
We were four guys riding our own car, looking for quite and peaceful to enjoy two days away from crowed.

This is the excellent place experience the typical bedouin lifestyle.

The family is friendly starting from brother Mohammed the organizer and coordinator
Mr. Ayman, spent his time with us and took us around to see Petra and other atractive places.
The father Mr. Khalil, who speaks several languages and has lots of stories were told during night time around the fire.

Definitely the place is great for families or group, many things can be done at the place or around. And sleepng in the cave is great experience , you will fresh and safe.

Make your next plan, and visit this family.
Very authentic Bedouin / rural Jordan experience. Your stay directly contributes the economic health of a small Bedouin community.

Authentic experience!
Good to stay woth Jamleh and her very welcoming family.
The view including sunset, sunrise and stars from the cave is beautiful.
Ideally base price would be a little higher and transfers included as this is the only way to reach the cave (impossible in anything other than a 4*4 and would damage a hire car).

It was an amazing experience to stay in Jamleh’s cave. We were welcomed by her family and friends before being driven to the cave, which is really remote and quiet with fantastic views. She prepared us a really tasty meal and tea with her husband. We sat by the fire under the stars which was really unforgettable. She made us a lovely traditional breakfast before her friend dropped us at Little Petra to take the back route to see the Monastery. A must do if you’re visiting Petra, so much more memorable than a night in a hotel!

The stay at the cave of Jamlehs family was really nice. We have parked our car in front of their house. They let as take a shower at there (as there is no shower or toilet at the cave) and then they drove us to the cave which is around 5-10km outside their village. The cave was very nice and cosy. It was really warm even it just had around 10degrees outside. Jamleh and her husband stayed there overnight too in the cave next to ours. We had a lovely dinner together and enjoyed the quiet scenery as it is really remote with no electricity, phone signal or running water. It was an experience you don't have too often nowadays. Thanks for having us, we really enjoyed it :).
Excellent
Great experience. Highly recommended if you want to feel the true nature of Jordan. Jamleh is fantastic host.

The family is really friendly and lovely and the accommodation, the cave, is at a great location. You can watch the stars and we had a bonfire in the evening and tea and henna. It’s a silent location, so we slept very well. But we had to drive with our rented car to the cave in a pretty bumpy road and we were afraid that the car would get damaged, since we had no jeep and there were a lot of big rocks on the way and it was also sandy, although it’s listed that transfer is included. Apart from that the breakfast and especially the tea was delicious.

This was such an authentic experience in Petra! Jamleh & her family welcomed us into their home for tea. From there, we drove together to the camp. They had a fire built, and the starry sky was absolutely beautiful. Despite the communication barriers, we definitely enjoyed our time & would recommend this stay!

It was the second time we were in Jordan with friends. As was written in previous comments, everything was fine and it was a unique experience do us to spend a night under the stars. We had dinner and breakfast. The location is awesome and it made us a real impression. I can fully recommend this place. Jamlleh and her son Mohammed are very nice and friendly. It was a pleasure to be their guest.

We really appreciated Jamleh’s and the whole family’s kindness, hospitality and willingness to give us the best experience. It was fantastic to see the family’s house, have dinner there, then be able to clean ourselves at the house, see the family goats and their milking and finally enjoy the most amazing evening and night under the stars and nearby the cave. The peace and quiet, the nature, getting to know Jamleh and the family and learning about the local Bedouin lifestyle blew us away.

the cave and surroundings are honestly so stunning and our one night there was beautiful.

communication with jamleh’s son mohammed was seamless as he was super responsive.

dinner and pick up from wadi musa actually cost extra (the drive is stunning though!). the cave is around a 15-20 minute drive from Petra but jamleh’s family helped organise a driver so the distance was unproblematic.

If you’re looking for an authentic Airbnb experience, this is it.
Jamleh and her family warmly welcomed us in their home. Her son greeted us on arrival at their family house, which is the address indicated for checking in. You’ll go to the cave later on, which is a 10min drive from the village house. The road is bumpy for the last 5min, but nothing to worry about. Network works smoothly in the village, but you won’t have any connection in the cave because it is too remote in the mountains. Nevertheless, this gives you the opportunity to experience the Bedouin lifestyle to the fullest. In fact, Jamleh will ensure you feel at ease at all times despite not speaking English and relying on her son to communicate. She will prepare a delicious breakfast for you, at your preferred time. Home cooked dinner can be arranged on request, and we can only recommend it.
When it comes to visiting Petra, you still need to drive about 20min to reach the entrance of the area, yet the drive is surrounded by a beautiful scenery.
I wouldn’t know how to describe how happy and touched we were to meet these people and to have a chance to live at their place.
Living in a cave is a unique experience, and Jamleh made it exceptional.
Amazing experience

This place is unique, peaceful and calm! we spend an entire afternoon with the family, had tea, Shisha, local food and a really delicious dinner, which got prepared the entire afternoon. Sitting and talking about life, Bedouin lifestyle, until the early hours next to the fireplace was just amazing.
I would definitly recommend it to anyone!

Jamleh was a wonderful host. She prepared a great dinner and then go far and beyond to make our night a truely unique experience. We got another option to sleep under the stars and she with her housband helped us with setting up a fire and a proper place to sleep. At the end we've got a gift from her for our friend who was getting married soon. It was an amazing experience and I recommend anyone to come there if visiting Petra.

The whole family made our stay very special, we received the most warm welcome, including delicious feast, pleasant talks and an open invitation. Hospitality in Jordan is a true pearl, this is the impression I've taken home. The cave in which we slept is a cozy place, beautifully decorated and located in a place which allows stargazing. I recommend whole-heartedly!

Like the description says we experienced the authentic lifestyle at a Bedouin family. Jamleh and her husband Halil were super nice hosts. We stayed for two nights and got instantly integrated into their family and never felt uncomfortable at any time. The traditional food was so delicious and the cave was very cozy. After dinner we were sitting all together at the fire, talking and drinking cay. Me personally would recommend this location to all my friends which are going to visit Jordan or especially Petra.

Extraordinaire!
Si vous passez par Petra il vous faut vivre cette expérience chez Jamleh et sa famille ! Prenez le dîner et le petit déjeuner car vous partagerez un moment inoubliable avec eux.
La grotte est accueillante et confortable, vous dormez sur des matelas au sol avec des couvertures propres et chaudes.
Un moment hors du temps !
Et le matin , votre vue se perd dans l’immensité des collines blanches.
Merci Jamleh et ta famille pour ton accueil!!

localizedReview.comments:
Extraordinary!
If you go through Petra you have to have this experience at Jamleh's and his family's! Have dinner and breakfast as you'll share an unforgettable time with them.
The cave is inviting and comfortable, you sleep on floor mattresses with clean, warm blankets.
A timeless moment!
And in the mornings , your view gets lost in the vastness of the white hills.
Thank you Jamleh and your family for hostingus!!

primaryHost.about: I am a local Bedouin that has been born in cave of Petra and lived here all my life. I love making local crafts such as handmade Bedouin carpets and I also have a big heard of sheep from which I make my living

reviews.comments: The Nest was a beautiful and peaceful romantic getaway for my husband and me! I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a couples vacation!

Our stay was exactly what we were looking for. Peaceful, secluded, relaxing. We loved the set up. The instructions were clear. Everything was as expected. It had an open nature treehouse feel but we felt comfortable there. Looking forward to being regular patrons.

Overall it ended up being a relaxing couple of days.

Pros: Neat house, very unique, loved the hot tub and super high tech toilet. Saw owls, song birds, and lots of deer. The location is peaceful and quiet. The patio in the rain was heaven. Robes were great, beds comfortable, the lighting is fantastic, and the fairy garden was a cute addition my daughter loved.

Cons: the outdoor shower was broken and we had no prior notice (a huge selling point for my daughter). There’s no stove top which is advertised, but the grill top was a disgusting mess and there was no scrubbing brush or cleaner for the stove. I called Cheryl and Kenny and they sent a cleaning team over. Cheryl was rude when I brought these things to her attention and got short with me. The bathtub (our only means to bathe) had a small hot water heater and ran out quickly. Lastly, I felt very uneasy in a cloth house with easy access on the west side and just below the balcony. Ultimately. I felt exposed.
reviews.response: This guest was given a full nightly refund of $770 for his two nights.  I wonder why he did not open with that part of the stay? Or that one of the main rules of our property is no children under 10. Getth reached out to me early in the morning concerning the shower that was not functioning.  The shower mixer had broken the stay before and we did not have time to replace with a new unit.  I apologized. Then he began discussing how his 3 year old was so disappointed.  I told him that NO CHILDREN are allowed at the Nest under 10.  He asked me to call him and we began our discussion that did not go well.  First he complained that there was  no cooktop inside the tent.  I explained we designed that on purpose as cooking grease and smells cling to the material ceiling of the tent, so we provided a side cooker on our bbq grill outside.  It is glamping. We also have the oven, instapot, and a microwave.  This was not satisfactory for Getth.  He then moved to the grill, and yes it was a mess.  This was completely our fault and I immediately offered to pay for his family to go to a great breakfast restaurant while the cleaning crew came to address the grill.  Getth did not want to leave and Getth did not want us to clean the grill. He then indicated the propane tank was empty, which we knew was not, but we bought an extra one and the cleaning crew brought it to the Nest.  Getth DID let us clean the grill once we were there. On our call he began reciting the Airbnb page and finally came to the part about the no children rule (whoops, he just missed that part).  Then he wanted to know why there was no lake access?  There has never been lake access at the Nest. He then went on and on about having too many rules.  It was all just so wrong for him and he was threatening that he wanted compensation for the shower and the dirty grill. I was fine with that, but after much verbal abuse, I had had enough of Mr. Getth.  I just refunded his nightly rate completely.  Funny, after that he became very thankful and docile.  We have had over 300 guests stay here and I have never had anyone complain about a "small" hot water tank.  This is the first I have heard that he felt "exposed" being in a cloth house.  The Nest is a tent after all.  I have been doing this for over 12 years and we continually try and make all the details better and fix any one of them that is a problem or an issue.  We respond as quickly as we can to any concern, but we could not please this guest.  Nothing was going to make it better, not even a full refund. We truly want our guests to be close to nature while having luxury amenities.  It is a balancing act and we fail sometimes like all humans, but having a guest berate you when you are trying everything you can do and still it just isn't enough is hard to take.

reviews.comments: The Nest was beautiful and neat place to stay.  I thought it was going to be more private than it was.  It was a relaxing place to stay, but a little over priced.
My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon! We had a great time relaxing and enjoying each other’s company! The Nest was very peaceful and romantic!!

Pros: The location was great. Everything was clean and nice. It was romantic and we had a wonderful anniversary there. It was well stocked and the jacuzzi was nice even though it was cold outside. We found some
nice places to eat and it wasnt too far off the beaten path that the drive into town was long.
The property manager is extremely responsive. We had a small issue and he responded within minutes.
Cons: Because it’s a tent, expect outside noises to carry. Think leaf blowers, birds, basically any noise from outside. The location was secluded so this wasn’t too bad but the neighbors are really into leaf blowing. Lol.
The glass doors let in light and it’s a little disconcerting when sleeping at night because they aren’t covered. But the locked entryway into the deck made us feel safer.
Lastly, it's a small thing but the floors arent even.
Overall we enjoyed our stay and have recommended The Nest to friends.
reviews.response: Tanielle, thanks so much for your review.  Yes, this is a tent and the outdoor noises do penetrate.  We think this is a wonderful feature minus the leaf blowers!  We strive to give an ultra luxury experience while bringing you close to nature. Due to the drought this year followed by a lot of rain, we have had some settling and that has caused some fit issues.  We have these slated to be addressed in the spring.  Thanks for your feedback and I hope you will also check out our new tents in Hot Springs that will be open spring of 23.  They will be called The Covey.  Private stocked pond, and no leaf blowers near!  God Bless, Cheryl

reviews.comments: Very nice couple's retreat.
Had a wonderful time!
This place met all of our expectations. What a special retreat you have created here. Thank you for hosting us.
Great experience! A lot of attention has been paid to getting all the details just right, and it shows!

The Nest is the perfect get away. We spent two nights celebrating my husbands 60th Birthday. It’s tranquil, romantic, comfort, and all close to town. Honestly I would have never left. Book this gem. You won’t regret it.
Wonderful spot. We stayed here for our anniversary and it perfect. So relaxing and inviting. We will definitely be back.
We had an amazing time at the Nest!  It was exactly what we were looking for.  A relaxing getaway ;). Thank you!!
The Nest was absolutely beautiful! Very peaceful, and the hot tub was so relaxing. I can’t say enough great things about The Nest!

The Nest is magical. It’s uniquely peaceful, pairing all the comfortable indoor features with a sense of connection to nature. Everything is spelled out clearly in the guest manual, and everything we used worked the way the manual said it would. We went in October, and agreed we’d love to see it in all 4 seasons. We’ll definitely try to come back!

Words cannot describe how serene this location is. I felt as if I was in a nature lover’s paradise. From the wooded area adjacent to the tent to the nearby lake, everything was beautiful. The inside quarters were equally breathtaking: soft cushy bed, comfy couch, and a bathtub to die for. I will definitely be returning!
Perfect getaway spot. Will come back!

Cheryl’s place is AMAZING! It is secluded and private, gorgeous and comfortable. Anything you need is right there. The hot tub and outside area are so nice in the evening as well as the outdoor shower. We had a wonderful time!

I had this location saved for a few years. It looked like a unique place to stay. I’ve stayed in tents in Africa (and mud huts) so I was curious about it. The tent is high quality giving you luxury & tenting together. Really enjoyed it. We had an unfortunate experience no fault of the owners of having a nearby transmitter go out & get replaced (loud) plus a good bit of leaf blowing but other than that, the location is peaceful.
We loved our time here and wouldn't hesitate to stay again! The tent was beautiful and spotless with almost everything we needed.

name: maison troglodyte dans la falaise de tuff

reviews.comments: Beautiful house in amazing place. Better than in pictures, very comfortable, perfect to relax
Words cannot describe how fantastic this house is. Wonderful energy, stunning rooms and breathtaking views. We fell in love with this big old cave and can't wait to return.

Amazing place! Leaving in this amazing house for two days was a one of a kind experience!
We had so much fun going up and down the stairs!
The shower is something unique, super comfortable.

The main bedroom is so romantic and atmospheric.
We enjoyed so much our stay and Celia was super helpful and an amazing host! Thank you so much :)
We will be for sure back to cotignac and hopefully to this museum-house that our 16 month son so much enjoyed! :)
A very special place to stay! Completely unique! Amazing location in a beautiful village, we loved it. Communication from the host was really good.

One of the most beautiful and special places we ever booked.
The pictures are great, but the real location is even better.
Cotignac is a wonderful village, and the house was the perfect choice.
The stay was an unique experience, not only a place to sleep. Would not recommend for people with mobility issues, but this is clearly stated from the beginning. The bedrooms are very cosy, the personal touch all over the house is wonderful.
Highly recommend this place!
Absolutely amazing town and this stay was the perfect cherry on top. Feels like living in a fairytale

Amazing place . Attention ti detail is amazing. Very romantic house built half in the rocks . The pictures on airbnb although great don’t even do this justice. The village below is very beautiful, the people friendly, the food 👍

Trip highlight! If you’re looking for a unique stay this is it. The cave house is about as 5-star as you can get for holes-in-rocks accommodation. It is quirky and weird and all kinds of wonderful. But, you need to be up for a challenge! There are 40 crazy uneven twisty steps with a rope railing between the top floor (amazingly neat) bedroom and the ground level bathroom. There isn’t a level floor in the entire place. You have to duck and manoeuvre to get into some of the rooms. And by rooms I mean grottos. It’s all part of the charm but not for little children or anyone with balance or mobility issues. The pathway to the front door was a little challenging. The drive in to the village was a bit dodgy but the parking lot was roomy and level (you’ll appreciate the juxtaposition of this statement if you come). We were greeted by a lovely host with  friendly welcome and great suggestions for nearby sights. We read that wifi was a challenge here - supposed to be better outside the front door but we didn’t get the password so can’t confirm or deny this claim. The village was charming. Lots of restaurants. The views of and from the troglodyte house were spectacular. This stay was like living a part of history. If ever there was a time when you wished “if only these walls could talk” this is it.
Such a beautiful place in a great location. The views are amazing and the bedrooms are stunning. We would really recommend it. Cotignac is so friendly, and the caves are fascinating.

Fantastic, original house in a dazzling location: artefacts and rustic furnishings feel as though both Van Gogh and Picasso in some other life might have stayed at some point; light coming in through small windows adding a touch of Vermeer… The steep spiral stairs and some low ceilings may be challenging for some but well worth the effort for the buzz of living in a lava rockface - and the sheer (ha) history. Note to budding Rachmaninovs: don’t expect wonders from the piano…

We loved the place! Very Unique. Make sure you are comfortable with stairs before booking.
1 thing that should be noted is parking a car close to the house is a bit tricky. We had a BMW as a hire car and it was a bit low for the roads in town, there were some tight corners on steep hills. A normal 4 door hatch back would be fine 👌🏻 Enjoy.

One of the most unique Airbnb’s in the world! Found in the quaint village of Cotignac, it has everything you need. It was very difficult for my partner and I to leave, we could have stayed for another few days. We loved its quirky character, its history and the beautiful location most.

The home was thoughtfully stocked with cooking utensils, crockery and cutlery. While the kitchen is very small, you may find eating in the village of Cotignac (only a few hundred meters away) more convenient. We made breakfast for ourselves in the little space without too many issues. Dinners in Cotignac were superb.

The beds were comfortable, and the home is interestingly decorated. It gets a little warm at night (we visited in high summer), and there is no modern air conditioning. A couple of electric fans are provided.

Be aware that it is a very old house built against a cliff, so it isn’t child-friendly; some of the ceilings and stairs can be a little dangerous if you don’t pay attention.

The Côtes de Provence area is wonderful with many great wines and fantastic food, and has many interesting towns and villages all around.

A beautiful, once in a lifetime stay, but very rustic.

Pros:
-Beautiful and unique
-Great deal for 3 beds
-Beautiful town/view

Cons:
-Tricky stairs
-Kinda spooky (little lighting/cobwebs)
-Mosquitos
- Very hot in the master bedroom
- Some appliances didn’t work
-Low ceilings/doorways
Amazing place, do not hesitate to book a stay here !
The rock house gave us the exact vibe we wanted. Every room is furnished with love and from the kitchen you can see over Cotignac.
Very unique location and beautiful arranged with a lot of traditional art in-house.
Absolutely incredible! If you love an adventure this is definitely the place for you!! Stunning location, incredible views and a quirky home you won’t forget!

This is probably the most beautiful and unique Airbnb I ever stayed at, it feels like staying in an old castle tower with back walls of cave. The rooms are wonderful, the decorations and furniture so tasteful and the building architecture combines with the cave wall in beautiful ways .  From the kitchen you have a wonderful view of the village and the landscape beyond. It is very vertical and stairs in between every room, you definitely get a workout staying here. We stayed during the hottest summer yet, and the top bedroom got very hot. Every other room was great though and fans are provided. We also couldn't connect to wifi, but managed without for a few days. We really enjoyed our stay here, what an unforgettable experience. Merci!

This airbnb is truly an experience! Me and my sister loved our stay here. Besides the cave house being a treat, the town of Cotignac was what won our hearts over in the end! Such a great town with so much history, artists, and good food. We loved how the home was decorated and the place truly had everything you would ever need in an airbnb, there was quite a few spiderwebs but kind of inevitable when in a cave. We had a problem with our wifi but honestly we just ended up getting a french SIM card at the Tabac store and our problem was solved! We were too busy each day to have even used the wifi at the unit, this is definitely not a complaint just a heads up if you're expecting this place have A+ wifi.  This place is definitely worth the trip, for the character and history of the unit but also for the character and history of the town!
Beautiful house in a beautiful location. Must be seen to appreciate its unique charm. The host was lovely, fast responding and extremely accommodating.

photos.caption: la falaise de tuff où se trouve la maison troglodyte

name: Geodome Private peaceful Getaway near Lake Travis

reviews.comments: Geodome is such a beautiful, modern, and spacious home. My family and I felt right at home. We thank Dan for his quick response and for being a great host.
Amazing weekend stay with 12 people. Perfect location and house for an engagement party!
It was fun to be in an interesting structure and have plenty of space for several couples.

The geo dome was AMAZING!! The pictures (as great as they are) don’t even do it justice. It looks better in person! And even a little larger than what I was expecting. Me and 7 friends came down to get some time together for the holidays and it was just the getaway that we needed. We stayed in and cooked all of our meals and the kitchen was stocked with all of the dishes and utensils we needed for each meal. A great place to gather. Lots of daylight thru the windows made for great moods and good energy! Definitely saving to my favorites for another stay when the weather warms up!
Check in was easy and communication was great!
Great place, interesting structure/building. Lots of privacy. Does not have a laundry--so pack accordingly. About 40-1hr away from downtown Austin area. Close to the zipling / waterworld place.
Nice place to stay.
The Geodome is truly a gem! The house is thoughtfully designed and perfect for a fun get-away with some friends.

Just an all around amazing home and could not ask for a better host. Dan was quick to respond and answered any question/concern we might have had. Everything we needed was there and the house itself is just incredible. We had a larger group of 8 guys and everyone slept comfortably, tons of space, and no issues at all.

Would 100% recommend this house to friends and would 100% stay there again in the future. It's super close to so many great spots on the lake, too. Definitely make sure you rent a car for the weekend (don't rely on Uber) and plan ahead for food. There are still grocery stores and restaurants in a commutable distance, but just better to plan ahead. We still were able to get Postmates out there (just took a bit longer). No issues, though.
Wonderful home, wonderful host, wonderful trip!
Such a cool place and beautiful location. We really enjoyed our stay at the best dome home in Austin. The kitchen is great and so much room for everyone to sleep. Highly recommend. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Great location and a truly uniquely designed home. We had a group of 10 in for a weekend trip, and it was a great place for us. Highly recommend.
loved this home! hosts were very quick to respond, will definitely come back.
Beautiful house! We had the best time on a recent girls trip. The decor is perfect, and the big windows offer beautiful views, and there plenty of space for sleeping lots of guests. Highly recommend!

This house is beautiful and located in a great area! Overall I would give this house an average rating. There are some things that could be improved on. First the day we arrived the AC was turned off and the house was 87 degrees inside. It took almost 7 hours to get the house cooled down making the first full day we were there kind of wasted. This is Texas and summers are notorious for being hot. I would highly recommend the days the house has guests for check in that the AC be turned on early in the morning so the house is comfortable when guests arrive. Also to note is that at check in we were told that the AC in the master bedroom did not work. This is by far the nicest room in the house and sleeping in there was very difficult. If the AC was not working we should have been told in advance and/or offered some discount. This house was not cheap.

This house has great views and lots of doors and windows. One thing that was a bit frustrating was that many of the doors on lower level and one of the doors on the main floor had blue tape on them and a sign saying do not use. I can understand maybe having 1 or 2 areas of the house where you don't want guests to use but there were just too many. The most frustrating was the door that went straight to the driveway was blocked off which meant every time we had to go up the stairs to get in. It would have been nice to come straight to the lower level from the parking area. The lower level kitchen was also off limits and was not complete. It looked like it is just unfinished but it did not look like it was being worked on. There was no mention of this or any pics on the listing.

Last major issue was there were tons of cockroaches in the house especially on the lower level. We even found a huge dusty area in the window with cockroaches. We stayed 2 nights for an average of $1250 a night. I believe the cleaning fee was around $250 and for that kind of cleaning fee the house should have been way cleaner. The lower level specifically had tons of areas that were dusty. The doors and windows were not cleaned and we found cockroaches in many places. I would recommend they use a pest control company on the regular because of the location. Finally most of the dishes we had to re-wash before using.

It was all not bad, the host did communicate very well and respond to any questions very quickly. The location is amazing, and the house is beautiful. Very spacious and tons of room for activities and fun with a small group. The lookout at the top of the third floor is super cool with amazing views especially at sunset.

I am writing this review only in the hopes a few things are done better to make this house worth the price. I am not a big AirBnb renter but I have had a few and stayed in many with friends on their rentals and have rarely had any of the issues above if ever. I rarely write long reviews like this, only trying to provide constructive criticism.
Such a beautiful place!

Everything was as expected from the pictures/description. The owner could not be more communicative and responsive. Of the 100 positive aspects of the place from the stunning interior to the location near Lake Travis, the 1 downside is the 30-45 min drive to downtown Austin. The place provided more than enough room for our 11 guests. Highly recommend staying here.

Dan was a great host during our stay at the Texas geodome. My friends and family enjoyed ourselves immensely and soaked up every second of the surrounding nature this location has to offer. Dan was quick to respond to our questions/needs which made our stay very smooth. We will definitely be back. Thanks again, Dan!

In summary, I definitely don’t feel like I stayed at a luxurious home worth the cost of my trip. This home was by far the dirtiest places I’ve stayed at. It was also not adequately stocked particularly if you plan on staying at the home for most of the stay. I’ve traveled to many Airbnbs for work and for vacation, and had a wonderful time in other places and have given 5 star reviews, and all my reviews are equally positive. I don’t consider myself high maintenance, and from all my positive reviews, it seems to be the case. However, I feel the need to write this as it would be unfair for any future guests. I’ve never had to contact any owner as often as I did on this trip. I left feeling disappointed and just wished we stayed at a hotel, particularly after comparing this vacation home to the ones we’ve stayed at in Newport Beach or Yosemite. Details below.
With cleaning fee of $250, the place should be spotless, but we found remnants of m&m candies from previous guests on the rugs, debris in the corners of rooms, and spider webs everywhere… particularly on the ledges where there are funko pops.
There are 3 bathrooms in this home. As a note, when taking a shower, if you’re bringing a large group and wanting a warm/hot shower, you cannot shower using all bathrooms. Within 5-10 minutes, if all showers are being used, the water will turn cold.
There is also only one hairdryer for the entire place. I messaged the owner to ask to see if there were more. He only provides one which I did note that it’s unfortunate since they already knew there were 9 of us staying. We had to take turns using it which was very inconvenient.
I’ve never stayed in a place where I felt that I had to carefully use paper towels, toilet paper, and towels.
Their cleaning lady left only 1/2 roll of paper towel for us in the kitchen. We had to resort to using a roll we brought. You are charged an occupancy fee for extra guests which I understood and didn’t mind paying. However, there just isn’t enough supplies for everyone. For our reservation of 9 people, the total occupancy fee and taxes was $1059.70. This is in addition to the cleaning fee, service fee, and cost per night. Our stay for 3 nights was over $4,000.
There is only enough towels for each person to have one hand towel and one full size towel. Due to the very modern open concept that extends to the bathroom, it’s inevitable for water to come out of the shower area because there is no glass door. We had 4 elderly family members with us, and had to mop the floors in fear of them slipping when going to the bathroom. There was certainly not enough towels for this. (We don’t have young children. No one was splashing water intentionally.)
I did bring this to the attention of the owner prior to writing this review beforehand, and finally, they did give us the code to the storage closet to which we were able to get more paper towels, toilet paper, and towels. Sadly, though they didn’t give us the code when I complained the first day… Only on the last day were we given access, so we were rationing toilet paper and paper towels for most of our stay.
He makes a long list of things that can/can’t be done. I didn’t think much of it at first, but now I realize the owner must have had some rough guests who left the place in terrible condition. Because the owner isn’t local, the place is managed from afar and sadly, their cleaning crew is one of the worst. It just didn’t have the care and concern of an owner who stays nearby or a very good property manager.
Finally, I will say the home is beautiful in photos and will look great for any social media influencers. However, take note that the house is unfinished. There are areas not included in these photos that have yet to be completed. Including the downstairs kitchen. The owner does disclose that guests cannot use it. (Not that we wanted to use the lower kitchen, we were just surprised that at this price point, it is not only not useable, it is rusted with large holes in the cabinets.). The downstairs bathroom is also not redone which is not included in the photos shown.
Once again, at this price point, this is supposedly a luxury experience with so much potential. Sadly, we didn’t have that experience.
reviews.response: We will take Tiffany's feedback into account and try to improve where we can however Tiffany was the most high maintenance guest we ever had. There was simply no please her. She complained about spiderwebs on skylights, that she couldn't find the dinner plates because she didn't pull the drawers out far enough to see it in the back, and that she ran out of towels because she used them to soak up water after the shower. She constantly messaged us to complain and ask for things throughout the entire weekend so much so that we had to give her access to the locked supply closet just to appease her.  I Would say that her expectations are more in line with staying at a 5 star resort with 24 hour service which is not a reasonable expectation for an Airbnb in the hill country. Based on the overwhelming amount of positive reviews we have I think Tiffany's experience was more impacted from her unreasonable expectation that we simply could not meet rather then the actual intended experience we provided. I would not recommend hosting her as a guest again for these reasons.

reviews.comments: AMAZING stay here!
Great location! Really cool house. Fun for groups.
