name: Artist's Tower on the Sea
address: Bocas Town, Provincia de Bocas del Toro, Panama

reviews.comments: Filiberto’s tower house was absolutely the most unique stay I’ve ever had. And if you’re looking for something that you’ve never experienced before in your life, and truly unique this is the place for you. Myself, my husband and my two teens (in the end) ended up loving this stay. Unfortunately upon arrival it seems that Filiberto’s cleaners had put in less effort than expected off of both us as guests and the host. He was so apologetic and helpful and was fast to try to help with anything the cleaners forgot. There are also a few safety hazards that I have discussed with the host and hope for the health and safety of others that these are fixed. Outside of these instances we actually had a phenomenal time. We all acted like big kids again, playing Jack sparrow music and pretending to be pirates laughing and giggling all the way. Some key memories as a family were made on this tower and I we will never forget our stay. I would recommend 2-3 night stay max at this Airbnb. Great location
Beautiful house! Unforgettable experience! Filiberto was an amazing host!

Our stay was wonderful. Filiberto was kind enough to pick us up and drop us back off in town after our stay. The tower was certainly the most unique place weve stayed at this trip and just as charming as in the photos. Hes a vety nice man whos put a lot of work into his place and it shows!

This space is exactly as described. It is a bit like living inside of an art piece. Sometimes art pieces are not as comfortable to live in as the Marriott. Take a real inventory of yourself before committing to the space. There really are no walls or TV or AC. You really do have to take a small boat out to the tower and tie it up. If these things make you uncomfortable, check out his other listing. Filiberto is very nice and very interested in making sure that your stay is great. We would love to stay again.

This is the coolest place I have ever stayed, hands down. Filiberto was the best host and helped us with anything/everything we needed; even picked us up from the airport. This property is unlike anywhere else I have experienced; but is only for certain people/travelers. If you are not looking for a unique experience and a bit of adventure, don’t book this property. If you are looking for something completely different/amazing/not for the faint of heart, stay here!

Filiberto is a very friendly and hospitable person, who even cooked for us that night. We spent a nice evening listening to his interesting stories of an crazy Artist’s life. If you are looking for an unusual and unforgettable overnight stay on a self-constructed tower on the water with views to a non-touristy waterfront neighbourhood, should definitely visit Filiberto. Be aware that it is a bit adventurous, since it has no walls. 😉 Book some days in advance, so he can arrange everything (cause usually he lives there).
Thanks Filiberto for letting us stay in your very special house!

La torre es un lugar mágico y único, nuestro viaje a Bocas del Toro no sería la misma sin habernos hospedado en este lugar, Filiberto es un anfitrión muy atento y amable, la pasada en el pequeño bote lo convierte en toda una aventura, sumado a la arquitectura y el ambiente de la torre l, les recomiendo mucho el lugar, sin embargo aconsejo hablar con Filiberto antes de apartar para que el les cuente todos los detalles ya que el lugar no es apto para todo tipo de viajeros, para nosotros fue espectacular!!!

localizedReview.comments: The tower is a magical and unique place, our trip to Bocas del Toro would not be the same without having stayed in this place, Filiberto is a very attentive and kind host, the time in the small boat makes it a real adventure, added to the architecture and atmosphere of the tower l, I highly recommend the place, however I recommend talking to Filiberto before setting aside so that he can tell you all the details since the place is not suitable for all kinds of travelers, for us it was spectacular!!!

photos.caption:
Artist's tower on the sea.
The creation of the tower followed the protocol that was fashionable in Italy during and after the Renaissance. A scale model on wood plus the great help from old local artisans left behind from the tragedy of technology.
The light, one of the elements of magic, of Isla Colon Bocas del Toro, illuminates the tower in all it's splendid isolation.

Artist's tower on the sea.
The creation of the tower followed same protocol that was fashionable in Italy during and after the Renaissance. A scale model on wood plus the great help from old local artisans left behind from the tragedy of technology.

As the tower came to completion, the artist came to the realization that his "opera" had become a "pagoda on the sea" a fruit of his subconscious  entangled in the surroundings  around his childhood.The mementos of his father a diplomat in China... .
The front facing the land of "Bahia Saigon" sports a sculpture  with a flower pot behind with the caption "Medusae"one of the latest works by the artist owner: Filiberto Bonaventura.

The turret and top bed. 
The turret is at the very top, and is almost completely occupied by an "almost" double bed, ideal for lovers and with incredible views of mountains and sea.

The kitchen and dining area.
The kitchen boasts a very modern electric stove with a glass cover, and a gas oven underneath, also a lovely small table in the middle with space for six people, a hammock and various objects and paraphernalia... .
Paddle from isolation. My house there is also available on Airbnb.
If you leave out sugar-water, hummingbirds will surely visit.
Entered by paddling a boat and going up a tiny lift.

primaryHost.about: Basically I am an artist and lived my whole existence as such... Most of the money I make from Airbnb will be used to support my autistic son Flavio. I have been given a chance to better my income with the work I do for Airbnb... This is also an exploration into humbleness and empathy towards the rest of humanity... I am very grateful to every one.

name: Moon Conker, unique riverside  tree pod with fire

reviews.comments: It was great, I'll definitely do it again. There's amazing walks to do.

The moon conker has to be one of the most unique Airbnb's we have stayed at! Truly making a birthday weekend away special. Such a relaxing and peaceful area with plenty of things to do. Can't wait to come back.
Amazing 2 days in the mid Wales wilderness! Even in mostly torrential rain we managed to enjoy everything on offer!

You get very few perfect days and I'd like to thank the owners publicly for helping create one. The location is wonderful, going to sleep under a sky full of stars and waking up to the hills was idyllic.

Also I can't recommend a shower in the open air next to a babbling stream enough.
Perfect couples retreat, total relax and reset.

Booked this for my boyfriends birthday & we absolutely loved it. So unique, secluded & peaceful. We never left the actual site as enjoyed  just being there. The baths are really special experience…….took us 4 hours to heat the water up but that’s all part of the fun. We found the bed in the Conker really comfortable too - so much so we slept 10 hours each night. No visits from the squirrels for us but a visit from one of the pigs - which made us laugh. If thinking of booking, it’s definitely a must for a different kind of camping.

This place is incredible. Little-to-no signal so great for unwinding. Lots of fun making fires, having s’mores (they provided marshmallows - so lovely); ‘running’ baths (make sure to do this with lots of time ahead of you). Amazing views, great location - lots of sheep - lovely, hungry pigs. They provide more than enough basics/essentials. Absolutely would recommend. 2 nights wasn’t enough for our liking!
Amazing stay at this beautiful location.
reviews.response:
Hi Oliver,
Thanks so much for leaving this incredibly detailed review which we will take the time to study and see what we can improve. We are glad you enjoyed it. Overall I see where you feel we could have given you a more sustained feeling of luxury with respect to the food and fridge which would have been particularly noticeable this summer.
We have some ideas for a communal eco fridge for next year which would reduce waste and give longer stays the possibility of storing things for longer.

I dont know many places which are more secluded though than our lovely shady tree filled estate. Each pod has totally separate facilities designed for it as well as a new design for each one which requires a lot of love, time and energy to service…so I am puzzled as to why you think it isn’t secluded. I will definitely look into it though. All the very best,
Anjana and David

reviews.comments:
We did enjoy our stay however, for the price the execution of the final details wasn't what I'd expect for almost £200 per night.

Yes, we took headtorches & hand torches as recommended however, the lighting that was provided mostly didn't work; the battery LED lights didn't work, the string lighting from the road down towards the conker didn't work and in most cases, the wires had snapped, were tied in with plants on the ground or were totally disconnected from the solar cell. There was also zero lighting to the toilet, for the price we paid I would have expected far better.

Also, a lot of the wood supplied was wet so struggled to start the fire at times and the axe was incredibly blunt, which makes it more dangerous to use and much more difficult to make kindling from.

The trees & brambles scratched our car each time we drove in & out, which will cost money to rectify.

Also, the instructions for different types of waste was confusing and not clear where bags were for different waste products.

Finding the Conker was easy enough with the detailed instructions however, when then asked to park your vehicle 'in the car park you passed', this wasn't clear where the car park was, as it wasn't signposted anywhere, wasn't highlighted in the instructions before you reach the Conker and where we assume we were supposed to park, there were vehicles there already for the Tree Top tent, so felt like we would have been stealing another customers parking space for their accommodation.

The Conker is also not as secluded as is made out in the accommodation description. The road to some of the other accommodation onsite is only about 15yards up the banking from the door to the Conker. Due to this, it was possible to see into the conker if the door was open and also down to the cooking & fire pit area from the road - made very clear when a family walked along the road and we heard a young girl in the family shout to someone they were walking with 'Look, I can see people down there, they're having a fire', which destroys the notion of total privacy & seclusion and may make you reluctant to use the bath & shower facilities, if you know you could be seen by other guests.

The Conker itself is nicely decorated and the windows facing the sky give a great perspective when laying on the bed, but it gets VERY warm in there when the weather is nice and there's no ventilation beyond opening the door (which as we mentioned makes you visible from the road) and also encourages flying insects to come in. A can of Raid was provided to deal with these, but for the price I'd rather not have to choose between sweating all night or having to fumigate where I'm then going to sleep with dead flies around.

The lack of any ability to keep food cool is a major drawback for anyone staying longer than about 2 nights. We did bring a cooler bag as advised, with 4 ice packs in there and brought fresh food, drinks, meat etc for the BBQ. In retrospect, with the bag being sat outside in the kichen area and warming up from the moment we left home, it's not really safe to have food warming for days to then eat - with the only alternative being leaving the site to find a supermarket, which takes away from the wilderness experience. This was tipified by the milk which had been left for us to use (thank you for that, along with the Welsh cakes) had gone off in the cooler bag by the 3rd morning. A simple solution to this would be to provide a small gas fridge for guests to use to keep food chilled, fresh & safe for days.

Overall, we did enjoy our experience of cooking the BBQs, doing the fires for the bathwater etc, however considering what you're expected to bring, details that have been missed and the lack of genuine seclusion means we left feeling disappointed, especially after paying so much per night.
reviews.response: Response from you: Hi Oliver, Thanks so much for leaving this incredibly detailed review which we will take the time to study and see what we can improve. We are glad you enjoyed it. Overall I see where you feel we could have given you a more sustained feeling of luxury with respect to the food and fridge which would have been particularly noticeable this summer. We have some ideas for a communal eco fridge for next year which would reduce waste and give longer stays the possibility of storing things for longer. I dont know many places which are more secluded though than our lovely shady tree filled estate. Each pod has totally separate facilities designed for it as well as a new design for each one which requires a lot of love, time and energy to service…so I am puzzled as to why you think it isn’t secluded. I will definitely look into it though. All the very best, Anjana and David

reviews.comments: We had a great time staying at the Moonconker. Such a creative unique idea. Beautiful setting! Loved visiting and feeding the pigs! I would certainly go again but would be nice to see some more comfortable seating around the fire so that you can snuggle up and do some stargazing!
reviews.response: Thanks so much.. you are very right about the chairs. Its been on my mind for a while- we will make some more rustic and ones for your next visit. Best wishes for a long and happy life together and make sure you come back for your first anniversary.  X

reviews.comments: We couldn't have asked for a better time whilst we were there and are genuinely are considering coming back in different formats of groups / friends because of the experience! The conkers and treehouses were all unique and spaced sufficiently apart to gain maximal privacy but still feel out in the open and connected. Beautiful spaces and we can't wait to come back again.
reviews.response: What fantastic feedback Kieran, thank you for taking the time to write your lovely review.  We think the pods are great for friends - you are close enough to hang out, but have privacy, peace and quiet when you want it!  Looking forward to hosting you again - it's all lovely in the autumn as the leaves start to change...

reviews.comments:
The positives:

Plenty of firewood for the fire pits.
Amazing location, very few voices and absolutely no cars heard
The moon conker is literally completely isolated. In fact, we felt able to 'run free' for some time following our use of the bath. Not your usual experience of camping, at least not ours. Very wonderful.

The facilities at the moon conker were great.

No phone signal AT ALL down there which is what we wanted

Lovely to see the pigs at hogwarts and our dog had some amusing encounters with the sheep.


The negatives were the booking date was altered at very short notice and meant we only got one night in moon conker. We were promised compensation which wasn't given. A little chaotic. The lane to the conkers is also pretty agricultural, more so than the instructions even would make you expect and I did fear damaging my car, although in the end we were fine.

Overall, the experience at moon conker is exactly what we wanted. A reset of the soul. And we'd definitely recommend it. Even though we had some minor issues.

We'd like to go again for sure in future some time.
reviews.response: Hi there Dave, thank you for the review and the feedback!  We're SO glad you loved all that the estate had to offer and you have our sincere apologies for the snafus when it came to the last minute change to your booking - if you'd like to come visit Moon Conker and stay for a few nights we'd love to create a special offer just for you - just give us a poke when you're ready to come again!  If you're a real off-gridder then Moon is just GORGEOUS in the autumn as the leaves start to change - the risk of course being that the weather is...well, a bit Welsh! Even then, though, you have the nice cozy log burner to keep you and your toes toasty.

reviews.comments:
We had an absolutely wonderful time at the Moon Conker.

It was fantastic to be without electricity, phone signal, noise, and distractions from the modern world. (Though you do not have to walk very far to get phone signal again so this should not be a concern).

We definitely underestimated the other reviews and warnings of the squirrels.. they will find a way into anything edible (including our purée for the homemade pizzas!).

A truly unique experience and the camp soon becomes your home with a very cosy, comfortable, and spacious layout and atmosphere.

We would recommend for anyone wanting to switch off for a few days!
reviews.response:
Ooooh those cheeky squirrels! 🐿
Thanks so much for coming to stay, SO glad that you enjoyed that off-grid vibe that we've worked so hard to create!

reviews.comments: The most enjoyable trip, we took our dog with us and it was the most perfect adventure for us and him, living both busy life’s it was so nice to get back to basics for a few days (with no phone signal) the only thing we struggled with was no fridge!!! As it’s really back to basics, the baths where an amazing experience, the amount of land we had to explore around the area was bliss, the moon conker was spacious for 2 people and got really warm with the fire inside it which was one thing we where worried about when arriving in the cold & rain, I would 100% recommend to our friends and looking forward to coming back & doing the earth conker and treetops, we want to try it all now! Thanks for a lovely stay

Being ‘townies’ we had no idea how we’d get on! We LOVED it!
Watch out for the cheeky thieves 🐿 🐿 as they are not fussy about what they tuck into whilst you’re not looking 🤣
The off grid experience is liberating & we barely left the estate due to so much beauty surrounding us.
Would definitely look to go back using one of the other experiences on the estate.

What an amazing place!

We had planned to go on a couple of long walks on our weekend away, but we never left the woodland directly around out site. So peaceful reading and drawing, watching all the birds and squirrels play. We even had a couple of sheep wonder through.

Its an idea place to go and switch off and relax.

We loved it.

I booked the Moon Conker for 2 nights to celebrate my partners birthday and although it has so much potential to be amazing we left feeling disappointed. We were given a set of directions/images to enable us to locate the conker but we didn’t find them to be very clear, they were quite confusing and in my opinion some steps were open to interpretation which resulted in us going the wrong way up a very steep hill, a map would probably have been more useful.

When we located the accommodation it looked really nice on first impressions and we were very excited to get a fire going, heat up the baths and make pizzas with the pizza oven provided. However we were only left 2 small bags of kindling so as we had no logs we couldn’t heat up the bath, fire and make pizzas, we only had enough kindling to keep a fire going for approx 1 and a half hours. This was really disappointing and if being honest it put a dampener on our trip. The only reason I booked the conker was because of the baths and for the opportunity to sit in the bath and watch the stars, given it’s situated in a dark sky location. Unfortunately as we couldn’t heat them up and we had no logs to make the fire we had no choice but to go to bed early as it was too cold to sit outside without any heat, so we didn’t get to experience conker to the fullest, we could have been anywhere if I’m honest and it felt like we hadn’t gotten our moneys worth at all.

Due to the location being off grid and back to basics we didn’t want to have to drive whilst we were at the conker but due to the lack of wood provided the next morning we had to take a drive to the nearest shop that we could find so we could buy some. When I got signal again I saw a message from the previous day from the host advising that the “woodsman” had left some logs for us at the conker (the 2 bags of kindling). I messaged back to say we didn’t have any logs so we were on our way to buy some and I also asked where the funnel was for the bath as when we were reading the instructions on how to fill them a funnel was mentioned. The host replied saying that the previous guests had melted the funnel and didn’t acknowledge the lack of wood, again I was disappointed as a simple acknowledgment/apology probably would have made me feel less disappointed that I’d spent money on something that was unusable. The host didn’t say anything about dropping wood off at the conker so we spent £40 on wood so we could get the full experience. Also to add it would be helpful to either replace the funnel or update your instructions so guests aren’t spending time looking for things that aren’t there.

When we got back to the conker the log storage box had been filled to the brim with wood and kindling, showing us what we should have been greeted with the previous day. I couldn’t help but feel upset that this small action of replenishing the wood could have made our first night dramatically more enjoyable and not like I’d wasted my money.

Before our stay i received a lot of information and it was a little bit like information overload and I do believe that this could be simplified or provided in paper form at the conker so it can be fully digested. The annoying part of this for me was there was an list of essential items to bring which included flip flops and a toothbrush but no fire wood so I assumed we didn’t have being any, again adding to my disappointment above.

One final thing was that check out on air B and B states 11am, however in the information pack it states 10:30am (quite early in my opinion considering check in is 4pm). I emailed the host to clarify as the info was conflicting but she directed me to a link for the information pack and suggested I read it if I hadn’t already. Quite annoying as she could have just cleared in up in a quick message.

The second night was a lot more enjoyable as we were able to experience the baths and sit by the fire and watch the stars but I wouldn’t personally recommend booking the conker based on my experience as the attention to detail was lacking. I do think the pizza oven could also do with a clean as it was full of soot. The conker itself is beautiful and unique but it’s a shame the added touches weren’t up to standard.
A wonderful place to stay, in a brilliant location! Lots of information provided about how everything works and things to do in the area.
Absolutely amazing experience in such a stunning location would highly recommend!!

The Pentagon - a covered outdoor dining area

Fill the baths with natural, fresh spring water, heated in a ghillie kettle

primaryHost.about:
Hello there! 

My name is Anjana, and along with my husband David, we design awesome escapes in beautiful locations. 

We built our first home - the Curved House in Clapham - which featured on Grand Designs back in 2004. We live here with our three children/design consultants who constantly inspire us with crazy ideas! As a family, we only build getaways that we're passionate about. We put a strong emphasis on upcycling, sustainability and integrating our ideas into the environment.

Lawyers by trade, we swapped courtroom for courtyard and now we are always on the look for the next unique project. We're very excited to share our creations :)

name: Semi Open Bamboo Bungalow + Instagram Hammock Net

reviews.comments: Entering the villa is a bit tricky because the signed is not visible.  It is recommended to bring a small amount of food for the evening.  Perfect for finding peace.  one more must be careful because a lot of luwing.
Really lovely and welcoming staff. The room was amazing and great value for money we especially loved our hammock nest!
It was perfect and just like in the pictures, pool is super nice, food in the restaurant also perfect and lovely staff!!!
Great service, beautiful location. Staff were friendly. To note - the resort’s location is not accessible by foot so renting a scooter or utilizing ride sharing is a must.

This place is beautiful! We loved the pool area and the bungalow was super cute as well! It does get a little warm inside, but that is to be expected since it is partially open. The staff were very friendly and accommodating as well. Would highly recommend!

Le Bamboo Bali is a beautiful place to stay at! The check in process was super easy, there is always someone at reception which makes everything a lot easier. The pool is magical especially at night, there are pool towels provided and we spent a lot of our time here haha. The cleanliness of the room was very good and the staff were very accomodating in that aspect. The food is really good! Even though it’s vegetarian, it’s very flavoursome and filling (my partner and I love meat haha). The bed’s are comfortable and the shower pressure is amazing.

The only issues we had, is obviously the noise and the heat. It does state this in the description upon booking, so I don’t fault Le Bamboo bali for that as you are pre-warned before you go about the noises at night and there only being a fan because of the hut being semi open. My partner and I both struggle with heat, so the fan just wasn’t enough for us personally. Also, we had a lizard upstairs or somewhere near by and he was very loud at night 🤣 the crickets were also very loud, so if you’re a light sleeper you might want to take that into consideration.

Nonetheless, the stay at Le Bamboo Bali was amazing!!
Great unique place! Only negative would be the limited sunbathing spaces around the pool
A must go in uluwatu
Awesome location. Really nice and flexible staff. Loved the net for relaxing
Lovely place to stay. Very helpful staff.
Very nice - be careful of the maps location though as it’s actually further up the road than it looks!
Everything perfect!
Everything was great, thank you very much.

Amazing experience to stay in a tree house. The staff and restaurant were superb and the property was extremely well maintained. The stay itself was picturesque. You are exposed to the elements here with critters and heat so just something to note.
Great stay, nothing to declare. Great staff and accommodation. :)
Nice bungalows
This is a beautiful and highly recommended place 🤍 near very nice restaurants and beaches. We extended our stay and would love to be back 🙏🏽
Awesome place to stay! The view is breathtaking. The bamboo hut is comfy. The vibes are great. All in all it’s a perfect gem to explore Uluwatu.
Very beautiful place with kind and helpful staff. Nice view from bamboo house and pool. Definitely worth to visit!

Stay on 3-4 dec 2021, arrive at 8pm. Reception only until 8pm after that security will helps you.

Contruction is on going just next to it, be aware of noise from construction that start on 8am. Privacy might compromise, especially on the open bathroom.

Staff is friendly and helpful. Bamboo design is amazing, and the view are great.
You should spend more than 1 night here.
Be ready for stairs too

Thanks

primaryHost.about:
House of Reservations is specialised in handling reservations for tourism accommodations. We have someone 18 hours a day available to reply to your inquiries as soon as possible. 

We are in direct touch with the manager/owners of the place we are assisting with. We will also be available through Airbnb during your stay for any further help.

reviews.comments: Best Airbnb experience in a long time!!

This place deserves more than a five star review. It is perfect. It is well equipped and well designed. Our hosts Christian and his wife made us feel welcome they are very sweet people. I stayed here with my family of 5 comfortably. The view from the outside table is breathtaking. We drove to Baza about 15 mins away for dinner. I highly recommend Cu-chah restaurant. They have great service with great food. I believe they open at 8pm. Lastly, if you’re thinking about it?, just do it. You won’t regret it.

It was absolutely stunning. One of the most amazing and unique places we have stayed. There’s not much around and you need a car to get around but we went to the shops and cooked some lovely food and wine, the kitchen is very well equipped! I would 100% go again, such beautiful surroundings too. Very clean and hosts are always around if you need them. They have designed the space so well and the pool area is beautiful with little beds in the shade perfect for a little siesta. We had a small 4 month old baby and they provided us with a baby bath and a cot. Would deffo recommend for a chilled little break away. Thank you!!

The perfect place to chill for a few days! The caves are designed to a high standard and have everything a family needs.
Christian was super helpful and friendly.
We definitely recommend a stay!
Amazing place to relax.
An awesome experience, really kind hosts, the place is a hidden gem 💎
reviews.response: Merci vous trois pour ce gentil compliment !! ça fait plaisir !!

localizedReview.response: Thank you three for this kind compliment!! it's a pleasure!!

reviews.comments: I had stayed at Cueva Lucia and had the greatest experience! Laurence and Christian are the kindest hosts, who are always ready to help with whatever needed. The location and views are amazing, will definitely recommend to my family and friends!
reviews.response: Merci beaucoup, Niko, pour ce gentil commentaire, nous avons été très heureux de vous accueillir chez nous. à bientôt !!

localizedReview.response: Thank you very much, Niko, for the kind review, we were very happy to welcome you to our place. See you soon!!

reviews.comments:
We had such a wonderfully quiet break to ‘recharge the batteries’. It is remote therefore therapeutic in the most pleasant way. The setting is stunning, very special. Kind gestures never go amiss - Laurence dropped in a huge bunch of grapes straight from the vine one day, another evening we were graciously invited to dine with the hosts & other guests (though our kids had made other plans that evening so we had to decline) yet another morning Christian brought coals/wood for any BBQ we might make. They displayed a great balance between un-intrusive & superbly helpful.
A beautiful couple, so welcoming, an amazing spot in its entirety & so passionately built for the comfort of their guests!
Oh & if you think 3 teens will be bored in 3-4 days? No!
The local village, a drive away, hasn’t lots to offer though we enjoyed good value pizza in the Roca restaurant & went to Baza one night. However, it’s not for clubbing we came!
Christian & Laurence, thank you both so much!!
reviews.response:
wow, thank you very much for such a glowing comment, but it's also thanks to people like you that we love doing what we do and you make us want to do well!! a big hug to the whole family!!
Laurence & Christian.

reviews.comments: An exceptional experience to stay, with super hosts, in a beautiful environment, with Granada in an hour drive! We would recommend this appartments and will certainly come back!

One of the most unique places I’ve ever been, more/ less stayed in. The cave has such a cool feel and ambiance with the local terrain it is well worth the money if you want a great place to stay around sierra mountains. The host was more than accommodating for anything we could possibly need and were very nice people
A wonderful experience and a great contrast if you've come from the coast. Stunning decor from lovely hosts who've thought of everything. Literally naturally cool!

A peaceful oasis with incredible hospitality and wonderful energy! The hosts were so helpful with EVERYTHING and made the experience feel personalized and super comfortable!
We’ll definitely be back!

We had the most perfect stay in a truly exceptional home. We cannot find enough superlatives to describe Cueva Aventura and our wonderful, welcoming hosts Christian and Laurence. The stay exceeded all our expectations. Our home was beautiful - so many thoughtful touches throughout the cave and in the communal areas.
An amazing communal BBQ and huge outdoor table for entertaining - we had every meal at this table and made friends with the other lovely guests that were staying at the caves.
The pool is fantastic, plenty of room for everyone and the poolside chill caves were ideal to get some shade from the sun.
We wish we could give this stay more than five stars... without doubt the best AirBnB we have ever visited, we were so sad to leave, and have already booked for next year!!

Christian & Laurence - merci beaucoup, the perfect hosts!!!
reviews.response:
Merci de tous ces compliments, nous avons été enchantés de vous recevoir, et heureux que notre cueva réponde à vos désirs. Nous serons heureux de vous revoir l’année prochaine.
See you soon, Laurence and Christian

localizedReview.response:
Thank you for all these compliments, we were delighted to host you, and happy for our cueva to meet your wishes. We'll be happy to have you back next year.
See you soon, Laurence and Christian

reviews.comments: Cueva Aventura is a super place (a hidden gem) we stayed there for 3 nights in Cueva Lucia (2 couples). Christian & Lauren are great hosts and have created a magical place. We ventured to the mountains and saw Rio Castril & The Dam. We had the best chilled out break in the caves which included dressing as “The Flintstones” on our last evening. I would definitely recommend to everyone to try it out as we for sure will be back with friends & family. Thank Christian & Lauren for hospitality & sharing your experiences.
reviews.response:
Merci beaucoup de ces compliments qui nous touchent beaucoup, nous avons été ravis de recevoir la,famille Pierreafeu « Flintstones » , quelle bonne idée vos costumes, on y pensera pour votre prochaine venue 🍗🍗🍗🍗
Laurence et Christian

localizedReview.response:
Thank you very much for the compliments that touch us very much, we were delighted to receive the Pierreafeufamily "Flintsơ" , what a good idea your suits, we will think about it for your next visit
🍗🍗🍗🍗Laurence and Christian

reviews.comments:
Love, love, love!!
Initally we wanted a unique property in southern Spain and after much hunting we found Christian's place! And oh my, we got so much more than we ever expected. A magical oasis set in the most beauitful setting with even more amazing hosts!
Not only were the caves in imactulate condition Christian and his Wife went above and beyond for our stay and made it one to remember!
We could only stay 2 nights and wish we could have stayed much longer. There is so much more to do in the area or perfect for just realxing. So no matter how long you have we can't recommend this place enough..
We miss it already and can't wait to return again one day :)
reviews.response:
A big thank you to you two, you have the record of the most distant hosts !! thank you for this bottle of wine that made us very happy, you are both adorable and we hope to see you again one day!
Big big kisses and good trip around the world !!
Do not change !!

reviews.comments: We had a great time at Christian Et Laurence’s caves. On our first night we had a wonderful meal cooked by our hosts and it was excellent value. Both hosts were inttenitive wanting us to have the best stay possible. The pool was lovely, tad cold, but which is expected from a salt water pool. There were lots of great things to do in the local area including owl experiences and kayaking on the stunning Negratin Reservior. Finding restaurants and supermarkets can be a bit of a drive but it was worth it for the peaceful tranquility of the caves. The hosts are always on hand to help with directions or questions about the area.  Just be prepared for a few flies.
reviews.response:
Thank you Alice for staying with us, it was a real pleasure, and thank you for this nice comment, come back when you want!

Laurence and Christian

reviews.comments: We had the most incredible stay.

Nous avons passé un excellent séjour. Le cadre est remarquable et possibilités de très belles randos aux alentours pour les amoureux de calme et de nature. Literie très bonne et le gîte est aménagé avec beaucoup d’attentions. Christian et Laurence sont très disponibles pour des conseils sur la région. Nous reviendrons !

localizedReview.comments: We had a great time. The setting is remarkable and possibility of very nice hikes nearby for lovers of calm and nature. Very good bedding and the cottage is furnished with great care. Christian and Laurence are very available for advice on the region. We'll be back!

reviews.comments:
Nous n’allons pas tergiverser, nous sommes trois jeunes étudiants partis pour un moment inoubliable et reposant, nous avons misé en plein dans le mille.

En effet, ce lieux atypique est tout simplement incroyable.

Christian et Laurence sont des hôtes extraordinaires, accueillants, souriants et disponibles.
Ils nous ont donnés énormément de « tips »et conseillés sur les lieux à visiter.

Très simplement nous avons retrouvé une deuxième famille.

Pour nos lecteurs, nous vous conseillons la Cueva Aventura de Christian et Laurence à 100%, n’hésitez pas à réserver les yeux fermés.

Yvan, Dorian, et Paul,
3 jeunes Clermontois..
reviews.response: houlala !!! vous allez nous faire pleurer !! Merci à vous de nous avoir choisi et revenez quand vous voulez, nous on est là !! on vous embrasse les jeunes !!😉😘

localizedReview.comments:
We are not going to mess around, we are three young students leaving for an unforgettable and relaxing time, we have put in full swing.

Indeed, this one-of-a-kind place is just amazing.

Christian and Laurence are extraordinary, welcoming, smiling and available hosts.
They gave us a lot of “tips”and gave us tips on places to visit.

Very simply we found a second family.

For our readers, we recommend the Cueva Aventura of Christian and Laurence 100%, do not hesitate to book with your eyes closed.

Yvan, Dorian, and Paul,
3 young Clermontois..
localizedReview.response: houlala!!! you will make us cry!! Thank you for choosing us and come back anytime, we're here!! we love you young!!😉😘

reviews.comments:
Enchanteur! Un petit monde a part.
Un accueil chaleureux, toujours disponible et de bon conseil pour les itinéraires touristiques. Un grand merci de partager ce lieu magique.
reviews.response: Un grand merci à vous deux, ce fut un plaisr partagé !!

localizedReview.comments:
Enchanting! A little world apart.
A warm welcome, always available and good advice for tourist routes. Thank you so much for sharing this magical place.
localizedReview.response: A big thank you to both of you, it was a shared pleasure!!

photos.caption: La cueva aventura vue du ciel

reviews.comments:
It was a magical place, perfect to surprise your partner. If your partner like such places.

When we stay, it was a windy weather so whole night I can hear the wind and trees. Those wind sounds, gives the impression that we are living on the seaside. Just for info, if you can't sleep in such sound, then bring your own ear plugs.

We also ordered the breakfast, and it got delivered in the basket and hang to the rope. We pulled up the room and enjoyed it on the small, cozy terrace. The coffee was hot and breakfast is also great for such a place.

When I wanted to book this, I was going through the reviews and nobody mentioned the toilets.
Well we stayed for one night, the treehouse is equipped with dry washroom which is good for small stuff but for big dump. I would recommend go to the proper toilet, which is in the restaurant next to the entrance and it is around 5 minutes walk from the hut.
i enjoyed my stay. highly recommended for families with children :)

A decent stay in the middle of no where. Nothing much to do in the surrounding area. In the winters there is no natural light after 5.30 pm and if it’s raining you are kind of stuck in the tree house without Wi-Fi.
Also the rooms are tiny, meaning sitting too long inside playing games is slightly difficult.
Although I would not recommend it to families with kids. But it might still be good for young couples.
The host is good and the communication is well. The tree house in itself is one of the kind and very beautiful.
The shared bathrooms are decent for what can be expected in the forest.
a really cool place to stay, we did this as a stop over on way back to Paris, was great for a night

My wife and I stayed in the treehouse for one night. It was an amazing experience, the treehouse is absolutely beautiful. It is very basic, there’s only a bed (which was very comfortable) and a seating area inside and an outside seating platform but if your looking for a once in a lifetime outdoors experience this is the place for you. We also ate in the restaurant which was absolutely amazing. It was a real fine dining experience. Thank you so much Jean-Marie
It was a dream house above the tree. I suggest this place to all nature lovers. And Jean-Marie was great host.
Perfect place for a wonderful night, the breakfast was nice and delivered to pull up with a rope. Great experience
The Buildings are very unique, and futuristic. A must see sight. Get an extra blanket, because it can get cold in the night.
It’s such a magical and lovely place. Really looks like straight out of a movie. Everybody welcomed us warmly, especially the host. All in all a wonderful experience:)

We received a friendly welcome and all wishes were fulfilled! The next day we were allowed to stay even longer because we were stuck in a traffic jam in the evening. There are fire salamanders in the forest and the tree house settlement is very beautiful! Unfortunately, the tree house was much smaller than expected, but all the others are quite large.

Thanks for having us!
Kind regards Gordon & Jana
We had a very lovely time in the treehouse:)
reviews.response: We also had a lovely time to welcome you in our forest !

reviews.comments: Super nice tree house! lovely location and quiet
Absolutely perfect! We love this fantasy feeling , very cozy homes and incredible tasty dinner! We had fun and would like come more times!

We knew going in that this was an off season so it was going to be a bit cold but we brought extra blankets. The space heater was perfect and we were warm. It was a cute treehouse with lots of personality. The secluded area was great and it felt really private. the food at the restaurant was amazing and the chef and his wife were so friendly! great welcome and friendly hosts.

To sum it up: AMAZING!
The treehouse we booked was very cosy with many lovely details arranged inside and a great view from the „balcony“ into the forest. The (vegetarian) breakfast-basket was lovely as well and the coffee tasted really good. Chris and me are very tall people but we were able to stand inside the treehouse what is big bonus.
Didn’t give a try to the toilet inside the treehouse, because restrooms are only 3min away.

Some Tipps:
For cold nights, there is a small heater inside but better be prepared and take warm clothing for sleeping ;)
If you want to eat your own food at the treehouse, you need to take some dishes / plates with you.
Fantastic.All Enid Blyton fans will be in rhe Magic Faraway Tree.Loved it
Charming tree house! Don’t hesitate to come, it was a great experience.

Super séjour, un vrai bol d’air frais ! À faire sans hésitation, la cabane est super, l’environnement aussi, de quoi déconnecter de la vie de tous les jours. Merci encore à l’équipe qui travaille ici !

localizedReview.comments: Great stay, a real breath of fresh air! To be done without hesitation, the cabin is great, the environment too, enough to disconnect from everyday life. Thanks again to the team that works here!

reviews.comments: Unser Aufenthalt im Drommen war speziell, witzig und ein Erlebnis wert. Die beleuchteten Häuschen am Abend sind wirklich speziell und hübsch. Etwas schwierig war die Kommunikation mit dem Gastgeber. Wir haben leider nicht auf all unsere Fragen eine Antwort erhalten, was mich vor der Anreise verunsichert hat ob alles funktioniert. Besonders gut hat mir der Frühstücksservice gefallen, welches am Moergen per Korb und Seilzug geliefert wurde.

localizedReview.comments: Our stay in the dream was special, funny and worth an experience. The illuminated cottages in the evening are really special and cute. A bit difficult was communicating with the host. Unfortunately, we did not receive an answer to all our questions, which made me unsure before arrival that everything was working. I particularly enjoyed the breakfast service, which was delivered on the Moergen by basket and cable.

reviews.comments:
Super wk! Les cabanes sont super chouettes. Au mois de novembre il y fait frais c’est sur mais il y a un chauffage d’appoint et une bonne couette! C’est une cabane pas un hôtel où un chalet. N’espérer pas y retrouver le même confort. Mais l’expérience est très agréable. Ça fait du bien d’être déconnecté. Les toilettes et la douche communs ont toujours été propres alors que toutes les cabanes étaient habitées. Le cadre est cool. On a fait de belles ballades à travers la forêt directement en partant à pied de la cabane. Regardez sur visiorando !!
Jean-Marie c’est montré très sympathique.
Les petits dej étaient bon.

localizedReview.comments:
Great wk! The cabins are super nice. In November it is cool but there is an extra heater and a good duvet! This is a cabin not a hotel or a chalet. Don't expect the same comforts. But it's a very pleasant experience. It feels good to be offline. The shared toilet and shower have always been clean while all the cabins were inhabited. The setting is cool. We took some lovely walks through the forest straight from the cabin. Look on visiorando!!
Jean-Marie is very nice.
The breakfasts were good.

reviews.comments: Mirko is the nicest! His house is ten times prettier than in the pictures. Comfortable for 4 adults. The house is complete, cute and just perfect 👍 Thank you Mirko for allowing us to share the beauty of your place with us😀
Great place to visit.
If you’re looking for a relaxing getaway, you found the perfect place! Everything was perfect. The host is very generous ☺️

Mirko was an excellent host and...an artist. He built the house with a great sense of design and aestetics. It is also very comfortable for a family of 4 like us. We slept like kings in the big log bed. We were also able to taste the tasty juice that Mirko and his family produces. We would love to come back. Thanks Mirko... definitely the master not always builds straight :)
Nice place to stay, especially with young children.
The house is absolutely beautiful and one of a kind! Very clean with fresh lavender left for us on the bed. A really unique and cool experience

We had a wonderful time, Mirko and his fam are perfect host.. awesome experience , beautiful nature and the house is just stunning.. Thank you, Mirko!
We recommend this cute house!

Definitely worth the detour!
This is one of the cutest places we'veever stayed at and the price is very reasonable. The inside of the hut is much bigger than we expected, fully furbished and super comfortable. Every little detail is thought through. An overall delightful place to stay.
The host was very generous and had us try various produce from the farm the hut is on. Best Blueberries we've ever had. So sweet we decided to buy more.

We stayed for one night in Mirkos „hobbit-house“ and enjoyed the new experience. Mirko was very kind and gave us some excellent biological blueberries from his farm. Everything was clean and well equipped. We would come back again.
Andreas & Sabine
Nice place, we had a perfect stay.
The whole place is amazing! Our son did not want to leave😀We met a really nice people/owner of the residance.Highly recommended!

Extraordinary location infront of a beautiful wineyard. Well equipped kitchen and nice garden.
Check in/out went very smooth with Mirko.

I don't even have the words to describe the excitement. Everything about this place is beautiful. The village, the owner's farm, the people around, the hobbit house.
Every detail of the house is carefully thought out, everything is done with love. There is wood and clay everywhere. The house itself is incredibly shaped. We will definitely go back there again.
Great accomodation, very nice and cosy. Place is extra clean and you have all what you need in kitchen and bathroom. Vines are great.
It was a wonderful little house! The hosts were very kind, they even filled up the fridge with breakfast and wine. All in all it was a pleasure to be in Zemljanka Earth house!

BEST AIRBNB YET!!! I'm travelling the continent, and I never expect the level of accomodation I experienced here. Mirko and family were so welcoming, and the earth house is absolutely delightful.

Perfect place to kick back and relax to get rid of stress. The air and house just smells so nice (because of the wood probably) and the interior is so gorgeously crafted. I got to see the most incredible sunset from the porch my first night. Heating works well and the bed was so comfortable I slept like the dead.

Plenty of hiking or easy walking around the area, and all the people I met in Ljutomer were so unbelievably genial I got a culture shock. Mirko had even provided basics in the fridge for breakfast (eggs, cheese, salami, milk) as well as some of their homemade wine and juice which you just HAVE to buy and bring home.

Definitely will be coming here again the next time I'm in east Europe. Thank you for an amazing new experience and a relaxing break in my travels!
This is truly a special place. Our hosts were wonderful and helpful. They also gave us food and drinks for our stay. We had everything we needed.
Truly special place.
Very fascinating house and definitely worth seeing.Everything available that you need and extremely nice and caring hosts.
A true Hobbit experience! :)
Endroit idyllique pour se ressourcer

localizedReview.comments: Idyllic place to recharge your batteries

reviews.comments:
Let’s start by acknowledging how amazing this design is.
The attention to detail was is incredible. The location is beautiful, just be mindful to bring some snacks if you plan on staying for a while. I totally love the home and the host was great to deal with. Hope to visit again in the near future. One last thing the road getting to the location is flat but not paved but it is maintained. I believe it will be paved in the near future being that the location seems like it’s growing with beautiful homes all over and the view from this cabin is amazing.

We really enjoyed our time in this wow location. It is an unique experience to live in a tiny house. Also I really appreciate the guitar position in the yard and the view from the upstairs windows.
However there are a few aspects that cna be improved:
- the time of the light senzor at the bathroom or you need to dance while taking your shower 🚿😂
- a bit more things in the kitchen so you can cook easily and don't get too creative
- a message at the yard entrance: "don't disturb the guests"

The place is so unique that everyone wants to see it. So, we as guests, we had many guests coming to take pictures; some of them even asking an inside tour. 😁
Of course I know is not host's fault for that, it's just the "wow" factor. But still. 😳

We booked our stay for 3 nights in November and it was great. We went there for the experience of staying and playing the guitar in a Guitar House and, oh, it was a blast!

The attention to details is outstanding, even the outside strings have different thicknesses like real guitar strings.

The place, even though is not too big, is very well organized, and it has lots of storage areas, so we didn't feel overwhelmed by things or overcrowded.

The bedrooms are accessible by climbing a wooden ladder. The beds are comfortable and the view is very relaxing, having the mountains in front of us.

The place was very clean and we had everything we needed in the fully furnished and functional kitchen.

The area is private, very quite, the neighborhood is really nice, the people are respectful and the host was very helpful with everything, being very responsive.

We definitely recommend the place!
Sleeping and spending time in a guitar view with a breathing view of the mountains- this was a wonderful experience for us and our child! Amazing execution, experience, view!
Quiet location, big yard and the house has all you need. We are a family of four, with 2 small children and we enjoyed it.
Great location, great house. We had an awesome stay!
Definitely a place to put on your bucketlist 🤍 we recommend it to anyone who loves uniqueness and quite stays 🤍 you have all you need there, we didn’t encounter any problems ☺️

Great place, looks very good and it's perfect for photos. If you value privacy, I don't think it's a good place to stay, but if you don't mind someone that can just watch you sleep it's all good. The view it's amazing, the kitchen has all the necessary things to cook, grill or making coffee / tea. The bathroom it's large enough for such a small place and you have enough towels for everyone. Overall, it's a great place but keep in mind that you have neighbors all around, it's not located alone.

Charming house. Compact but cozy and with taste. The porch with chairs outside is also perfect to enjoy the starry summer nights. The beds are very comfortable, and there are some goodies in the fridge from the house.

Only minus is that upstairs the windows don't open. Even though there are air units there, they're noisy and it just doesn't compare to having some fresh cool air from outside.

We enjoyed our stay at the property. Dragos and his family were very helpful and communications were great. Property location is in close proximity to all attractions (you need a car of course). Place is peaceful and you will enjoy the nature very much. Dogs were so sweet. And the design of the house is brave and out of the box. Thumbs up for that
what an AMAZING home. Location, design, furniture.... everything was perfect. wish we had stayed longer and will return soon. Great to meet the owner and team!
Локация супер и Дом тоже. Советую.

reviews.comments:
Pro:
Gazda receptiva si înțelegătoare, nota 20
Pat mare
Curte spațioasă
Utilata

Contra:
Culmea ironiei: cazarea este în forma de chitara, dar nu poți asculta muzica afara din cauza vecinilor(decat la un volum mic)
Sus nu se deschid geamurile, daca este cald, aerul este irespirabil (ac nu face fata)
Una din camere are o inaltime sub 1.60, consider ca este o cazare destinata familiei cu 2 copii școlari.
N ai uși / perdele nu exista intimitate de niciun fel intre camere.
reviews.response:
Multumim pentru review
- Casuta se afla intr-un cartier de munte la marginea naturii si suntem foarte specifici referitor la poluarea fonica. Este un loc de liniste si relaxare unde respectam natura si comunitatea din jur indiferent de forma casutei.
- Problema caldurii de la etaj a fost deja rezolvata cu un nou AC, pe baza feedbackului primit din primele 2 rezervari,
- Este un tiny house, in poze se vede clar ca nu sunt separate camerele intre ele . Nu este o locatie de confort de hotel pentru 4 adulti si 3 bebelusi si am evidentiat acest lucru si telefonic, si prin mesaj imediat dupa efectuarea rezervari iar in anunt este specificat 'not suitable for infants'.

localizedReview.comments:
Pro:
Responsive and understanding host, note 20
Large bed
Spacious yard
Utilata

Contra:
Irony curtain: The accommodation is in the form of a guitar, but you cannot listen to the music outside because of the neighbors(and at a low volume)
Up the windows do not open, if it is hot, the air is non-spired (ac does not face it)
One of the rooms is under 1.60, I consider it a family accommodation with 2 school children.
You do not have any doors / curtains there is no privacy of any kind between the rooms.
localizedReview.response:
Thank you for your review
- The tiny house is in a mountain neighborhood at the edge of nature and we are very specific about f | pollution. It is a place of tranquility and relaxation where we respect the nature and the surrounding community regardless of the form of the cottage.
- The heat issue upstairs has already been resolved with a new AC, based on the feedback you received from the first 2 reservations,
- It's a tiny house, the pictures clearly show that the rooms are not separated . It is not a hotel comfort location for 4 adults and 3 infants and we have also highlighted this by phone, and by message immediately after making reservations and in the listing is specified 'not suitable for infants'.
